III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & R 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff
Section qualifications.
Description Rule 112. (1) Child caring institutions subject to 42 USC 671 shall
not permit a child caring institution staff member to begin working
unless all the following has been completed using the forms, and
in the manner, prescribed by the department:
(4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A former staff took a picture of an unknown youth at Vista Maria
and showed it to other youth. It is unknown if this was an
inappropriate photo of one of the youth in the facility.
These incidents may have happened around 2022/2023.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via phone on 3/11/2025.
Complainant did not provide any additional information.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 3/12/2025.
Youth A denied knowledge of any staff taking photos of youth and
showing them to other youth.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 3/12/2025.
Youth B reported she has never seen or heard of any staff taking
photos or having photos of youth. Youth B reported she never saw
or heard of any staff showing photos of any youth to other youth.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 3/12/2025.
Youth C denied ever seeing or hearing about any staff taking
pictures of any youth and denied knowledge or witnessing any
youth showing photos of youth to other youth.
Staff 1 was interviewed via video conference on 3/21/2025. Staff
1 reported she was working at the facility in the years 2022 and
2023. Staff 1 reported she never witnessed any staff take a photo
of any youth and never witnessed a staff show photos of youth to
anyone else including other youth in all her years being employed
at the facility. Staff 1 denied any knowledge of staff taking photos
of youth or showing them to other youth.
Staff 2 was interviewed via video conference on 3/21/2025. Staff
2 reported she has been working for the facility for two and half
years. Staff 2 denied ever witnessing or hearing about any staff
taking photos of any youth or showing any photos of youth to any
youth.
Staff 3 was interviewed via video conference on 3/21/2025. Staff
3 reported she has been working at the facility for 16 years. Staff 3
denied any knowledge or witnessing any staff taking photos of
youth or showing photos of youth to other youth.
2

Documentation reviewed:
• Employee Behavior Policy states that disclosure of
confidential information or taking videos, photos, of clients
without proper authorization is strictly prohibited.
Analysis There are no rule violations found regarding the allegation. All
staff and youth interviews denied knowledge or witnessing staff
taking photos of youth and further denied knowledge or witnessing
staff showing photos of youth to other youth.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of Staff
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Additional Allegation
Type
Allegation There are youth in the facility who are having sex with each other.
These incidents may have happened around 2022/2023.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via phone on 3/11/2025.
Complainant did not provide any additional information.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 3/12/2025.
As indicated above Youth A reported that she has not seen any
youth engaging in sexual contact or inappropriate behavior herself
and does not know any names of youth who might have been
doing this. Youth A denied any awareness of youth engaging in
sexual activity at the facility from years past.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 3/12/2025.
As indicated above Youth B denied seeing or hearing about youth
having sex at the facility from years past or currently.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 3/12/2025.
As indicated above Youth C reported she heard of specific youths
engaging in sexual activity together in the sensory room in
January of this year. Youth C denied knowledge of any other
youth from years past or now having been involved in sexual
activity.
3

Staff 1 was interviewed via video conference on 3/21/2025. As
indicated above Staff 1 reported that she was working at the
facility in the years 2022 and 2023. Staff 1 reported she did not
recall any specific incidences that youth were engaging in sexual
activity with each other in 2022 or 2023. Staff 1 reported she
heard about two youth at the facility being caught in the bathroom
together. Staff 1 reported she did not know what the youth may
have been doing but heard that it could have been something
sexual.
Staff 2 was interviewed via video conference on 3/21/2025. Staff
2 reported she has been working for the facility for two and half
years. As indicated above Staff 2 reported she has heard that
sexual contact between youth can be a concern at the facility but
has never witnessed any herself and was not aware of any
specific youth engaging in sexual contact throughout her
employment with the facility. Staff 2 denied recollection of
incidences as far as what was rumored, when, where, or what
youth were involved.
Staff 3 was interviewed via video conference on 3/21/2025. As
indicated above Staff 3 reported she has been working at the
facility for 16 years. Staff 3 denied any knowledge or witnessing
occurrences of youth engaging in sexual activity together at the
facility over the years.
Documentation reviewed:
• Client Sexual Activity Policy outlines the procedure for all
personnel to report possible activity to their supervisor,
complete an incident report for MDHHS, and complete a
plan of action regarding safety needs of the youth.
• 2025SIC0000283 was completed on 3/5/2025 regarding
the referenced allegation in interviews regarding youth
engaging in sexual activity in the sensory room in January
of 2025.
• Incident Report 17596 dated 10/17/23. IR states that two
youth were caught in the same restroom stall together at
Clara B Ford Academy. IR states that staff directed youth to
unlock the stall door and exit the bathroom. Initially the
youth did not comply however upon additional direction
they did comply. Neither youth reported that any sexual
contact occurred. The youth’s therapist and school
administrator were notified. Upon further review it was
reported that one of the youth may have self-harmed while
in the stall.
4

Analysis There are no rule violations found regarding the allegation. Staff
and youth interviews denied specific concerns of youth having sex
at the facility that were not addressed in previous investigations as
further confirmed via documentation review of past investigation
report.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
